reviews.text: Lovely little Yorkshire town, lovely old buildings a market plenty of quirky shops a river running past and some of the best countryside anywhere in the uk on your doorstep. Love the little wiggly back streets and Settle next door for everything else.

This railway station, is on the railway line between Leeds / Skipton and further north places such as Carnforth and Lancaster.

The station has two platforms, and each of the platforms has a sheltered seating area where you can wait for your train. 

Sadly, there is no live information regarding train arrivals, so you will have to sit and wait for your train (even though you don't know an accurate time  as to when a train is likely to arrive).

There is a small car park which can cater for up to about 10 cars (including one disabled car parking spot as well). Also, in the car parking area there is a place where you can store your bicycle (before you take your train ride). There is space for about 8 or 9 bicycles. 

This particular railway station is unmanned, and also there is no evidence of any security cameras in the surrounding area.
